wikipedia_page.main: Sir Kenneth Lyon Blaxter FRS PRSE FIBiol (19 June 1919 – 18 April 1991) was an English animal nutritionist.

response: In 1995 Robertson's book on food production (From Dearth to Plenty: The Modern Revolution in Food Production) was published by the Cambridge University Press. One chapter had been written by Sir Kenneth Blaxter before his death. Although Robertson wrote the rest of the book, with characteristic modesty, he placed Blaxter's name first on the title page.
In 1973 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were D G Armstrong, Sir Kenneth Blaxter, Sir David Cuthbertson, J A B Smith, G A Garton and C F Mills.
